li.a: NW Elementary Principal Winds Up On the ROOF!!
Project Mustang - No Tax Increase Bond Issue
High School and Elementary Announce Honor Rolls
Caitlyn Slaughter selected to Leadership Corps
NWHS Drama Club 1st Annual Spring Play
Nike Destroy Doubt Tour visits NWHS

p.span: The mission at Pettis County RV Schools is to empower each student to become productive and responsible citizens through highly-engaging instruction in a safe environment where everyone is valued, encouraged, and successful. The vision at Pettis County RV Schools is to create an exemplary school environment that inspires student and faculty excellence and delivers a quality education founded on high expectations, mutual respect, and individual responsibility.

br.p:
Pettis County R-V does offer
Missouri Course Access and Virtual School Program
for more information, please contact the district office at
660-827-0774 or the school counselor for assistance.

span.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; font-size: 32px; color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
span.span: Pettis County RV School District welcomes you to our website. We hope this can be a valuable communication tool between the district and community. This is the main district page. You can navigate to each building in the upper left drop down menu. If you have any questions and/or concerns, please contact us through the website.

img.alt: Missouri Department of Elementary & Secondary Education
img.title: Missouri Department of Elementary & Secondary Education

img.br: If you want to participate in the MAY board meeting, please check back for sign-in information.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(242, 242, 242); font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: I am so thrilled about the start of another school year! Our maintenance/custodial staff has been working hard to get the buildings ready for students. We have been completing the usual summer work and beginning work on the projects approved through the bond that we passed in April. Thanks to community support of the bond we continue to meet the strategic plan goals related to the physical buildings including: updating facilities and technology. The elementary is pushing forward, with direction from our new elementary principal Mrs. Kelly Weathers, on new curriculum. Both principals Mrs. Weathers and Mr. Hinman have already spent many days working on making this school year a success.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(242, 242, 242); font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: Parents, families, and community members play a pivotal role in the back-to-school success. Our students and our schools are only successful with the support of our patrons. Thank you for your commitment to the education of the youth in this community.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(242, 242, 242); font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: If you have time: stop by the school to visit, volunteer to read with an elementary student, watch a ball game, or join us at a Senior dinner. There are many ways to show your enthusiasm and support of the students and the school district

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: rgb(242, 242, 242); font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: Please call me with any questions or words of wisdom.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: rgb(242, 242, 242); font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;
